intro: Cupaniopsis tramitis, commonly known as the Cape York hakea, is a shrub native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cylindrical spikes. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with a deep root system for water absorption. Cupaniopsis tramitis is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of the local flora in its habitat.
